background.simple: Dominguez met Victim, confrontation, fight ensued.
background.detailed: Julio Alphonso Dominguez and friends met the Victim at a club and were invited to his apartment. After an inappropriate incident on the way, a confrontation ensued at the apartment, leading to a fight. The Victim locked himself in his bedroom.

evidence.detailed: Testimonies varied about the location of Dominguez's two female friends during the fight.

evidence.simple: Some said women were in bedroom.
evidence.detailed: Some witnesses said they were in the bedroom when the fight began.
Others claimed they were outside when the Victim locked himself in.

legalArgument.detailed: Dominguez and co-defendants claimed they broke down the Victim's bedroom door to rescue the two women.
They believed the women were in danger due to the Victim's earlier behavior.
They argued they were acting in defense of others.

initialJudgment.detailed: All co-defendants were charged with aggravated burglary.
Some co-defendants faced additional charges of aggravated robbery and assault.

appeal.detailed: Dominguez appealed his conviction of aggravated burglary.

outcome.detailed: The jury found all co-defendants guilty of aggravated burglary.
Dominguez was sentenced to ten years to life in prison.

otherInformation.detailed: Discrepancies existed in the testimonies regarding the location of the two female friends.
The defense argued they were justified in breaking down the door to protect the women.
A motion for a mistrial was denied after an officer mentioned Dominguez's mug shot.
Dominguez's counsel believed the jury instructions were inadequate.
